wikipedia_page.main: Lena Lowis (born Selina Caroline Shakespear) (3 November 1845, India - 18 November 1919, London) was an Indian-born writer, scientific and botanical illustrator, noted for her 1878 publication Familiar Indian Flowers which was advertised in The Times (London) in April 1881 as "with 30 coloured plates, 31s. 6d."
